activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rusty A. Bauknecht

records.addlTxt:
3:31 PM Defendant Rusty A. Bauknecht in court. Attorney Robert A Kennedy Jr. in court for Rusty A. Bauknecht. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Three Lakes Patrol Sergeant Thomas Maillette/sworn/direct by Schiek/witness identifies Defendant/continued direct by Schiek/cross by Kennedy/witness is excused. Court finds probable cause exists and binds Defendant over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint - other charge may be added when blood test is received. Court states there is no OWI charged. Court will set out arraignment. Court will allow remote appearance at next hearing. Kennedy statement to ankle bracelet. Bond continued. adj. 03:52 PM
Arraignment scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rusty A. Bauknecht in court.  Attorney Robert A Kennedy Jr. in court for Rusty A. Bauknecht. 
Calling 22cf154 and 22cm113.
In receipt of both complaint, waive readings.  22cf154 to be set for Preliminary hearing. Not guilty plea to 22cm113.  Time limits waived.  22CM113 to track along for status. 
Bail continued in both cases.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

The defendant is required to be monitored by the SCRAM bracelet through ADL Monitoring Solutions within 48 hours. The defendant is ordered to contact ADL at 920-283-1038 to make arrangements. The defendant is responsible for any costs associated with the SCRAM bracelet.

1:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Rusty A. Bauknecht in court. Calling 22CF154 & 22CM113. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Pfeifer statement to bail. Court set $1500 cash bond over weekend and has been posted. Court continues bond in 22CF154 and sets bond in 22CM113. adj. 01:41 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
